pullRequest.body:
We prove the [equational criterion for flatness](https://stacks.math.columbia.edu/tag/00HK). As a consequence, every homomorphism from a finitely presented module to a flat module factors through a finite free module.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->
- [x] depends on: #12647

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#12647~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (ðŸ¤–). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->

Hello, I managed to make `Algebra/Module/FinitePresentation.lean` fully universe polymorphic. This had the side effect of somehow breaking `RingTheory/Flat/EquationalCriterion.lean`, even though I didn't even touch that file. I think this is almost certainly not worth it. #13149

> Hello, I managed to make `Algebra/Module/FinitePresentation.lean` fully universe polymorphic. This had the side effect of somehow breaking `RingTheory/Flat/EquationalCriterion.lean`, even though I didn't even touch that file. I think this is almost certainly not worth it. #13149 

Oh great, thanks! I think the extra leg-freedom in the universe level of the indexing type will pay off, but I think we can merge this PR and generalize in a second step with your follow-up PR.

Hi, I'm sorry about the way I worded my comment earlier. I shouldn't be so dismissive about universe polymorphism; I now see it could very plausibly matter at some point. Do you have any suggestions for how to do #13149? You can make commits directly if you want.

> Hi, I'm sorry about the way I worded my comment earlier. I shouldn't be so dismissive about universe polymorphism; I now see it could very plausibly matter at some point. Do you have any suggestions for how to do #13149? You can make commits directly if you want.

Currently I am busy, but I'll have a look in two days.
Apart from one open question above, I think this is good to go. Since the universe generalizations depend on #13149, we can merge this one as is and generalize after #13149.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9364423361/job/25777393253)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9364423361/job/25777392357)

Thanks :tada:

bors merge
That's a very nice result! I left some comments below.

Thanks :tada:

bors merge

Could you please point to `sum_smul_eq_zero_of_isTrivialRelation` (maybe at the end of this docstring) to explain why the condition `âˆ‘ i, f i â€¢ x i = 0` does not appear in the definition of `IsTrivialRelation`?

I am worried that the markdown in the docs will be broken here (as in [TensorProduct.VanishesTrivially](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/LinearAlgebra/TensorProduct/Vanishing.html#TensorProduct.VanishesTrivially)), as the highlighting on github already suggests. I am not sure what causes this.
It looks good in the doc preview

Is `R` and `M` being in the same universe necessary here? Something like this:
```suggestion
universe u v in
variable (R : Type u) [Ring R] (M : Type v) [AddCommGroup M] [Module R M] in
/-- A finitely presented module is isomorphic to the quotient of a finite free module by a finitely
generated submodule. -/
theorem Module.FinitePresentation.equiv_quotient [fp : Module.FinitePresentation R M] :
    âˆƒ (L : Type (max u v)) (_ : AddCommGroup L) (_ : Module R L) (_ : Module.Free R L)
      (_ : Module.Finite R L) (K : Submodule R L) (_ : K.FG), Nonempty (M â‰ƒâ‚—[R] L â§¸ K) := by
  obtain âŸ¨Î¹, âŸ¨hÎ¹â‚, hÎ¹â‚‚âŸ©âŸ© := fp
```
I think slightly cleaner would be to introduce `universe u v` at the beginning of the file and have `variable (R : Type u) (M : Type v)` globally.
Postponed to #13149.

Is `Î¹ : Type u` necessary? I could image that in applications, `Î¹` will not necessarily be in the same universe as `R` and `M`, e.g. `Î¹ = Fin n` seems reasonable, but would not work without ulifting.

Changing this to `Type*` seems to only fail, because `VanishesTrivially` has the same restriction, maybe it can be generalized there as well (if only for the definition)?
Postponed to #13149 .

```suggestion

variable {f x}

```
I think `f` and `x` can be implicit in `sum_smul_eq_zero_of_isTrivialRelation` as well.

```suggestion
  simp only [IsTrivialRelation, VanishesTrivially, smul_eq_mul, mul_comm]
```
Same universe question applies here. As the `Î¹`s and `Îº`s are all `Fintype`s, at least mathematically speaking it should be possible to generalize it.
Also postponed to #13149 I think.

Why is the `âˆ€ (I : Ideal R), Function.Injective â‡‘(rTensor M (Submodule.subtype I))` listed here? Is this for making the proof more convenient? If not, maybe this can be dropped here as it does not really fit the "equational criterion" characterizations below?
Yes, it makes the proof more convenient.
Maybe the equivalence of `4` and `5` could be factored out in a separate lemma? (Maybe also the one of `5` and `6` but there the proof is shorter).
Whats your stance on this?

```suggestion
      _ = âˆ‘ i, f i â€¢ x (single i 1)         := rfl
      _ = x (âˆ‘ i, f i â€¢ Finsupp.single i 1) := by simp_rw [map_sum, map_smul]
      _ = x f                               := by
        simp_rw [smul_single, smul_eq_mul, mul_one, univ_sum_single]
      _ = 0                                 := hfx
```

```suggestion
      simp only [total_apply, zero_smul, implies_true, sum_fintype, finset_sum_apply]
```

```suggestion
theorem Module.FinitePresentation.equiv_quotient [hfp : Module.FinitePresentation R M] :
    âˆƒ (L : Type (max u v)) (_ : AddCommGroup L) (_ : Module R L)
      (K : Submodule R L) (_ : M â‰ƒâ‚—[R] L â§¸ K),
      Module.Free R L âˆ§ Module.Finite R L âˆ§ K.FG := by
```
Maybe it looks slightly cleaner with the `Prop`s moved outside of the existential and the `M â‰ƒâ‚—[R] L â§¸ K` inside?

```suggestion
    obtain âŸ¨Îº, hÎº, a', y', âŸ¨ha'y', ha'âŸ©âŸ© := hâ‚… this
    refine âŸ¨Îº, hÎº, fun i â†¦ a' (single i 1), fun j â†¦ y' (single j 1), fun i â†¦ ?_, fun j â†¦ ?_âŸ©
    Â· simpa [x', â† map_smul, â† map_sum, â† smul_single]
        using LinearMap.congr_fun ha'y' (Finsupp.single i 1)
    Â· simp_rw [â† smul_eq_mul, â† Finsupp.smul_apply, â† map_smul, â† finset_sum_apply, â† map_sum,

```
only if you like it golfed :-)

```suggestion
```

```suggestion
    refine âŸ¨Îº, hÎº, a' âˆ˜â‚— Ï•, y, ?_, ?_âŸ©
```

```suggestion
    obtain âŸ¨Îº, hÎº, a', y, ha'y, ha'âŸ© := hâ‚… this
```

```suggestion
theorem isTrivialRelation_of_sum_smul_eq_zero [Flat R M] {Î¹ : Type u} [Fintype Î¹] {f : Î¹ â†’ R}
    {x : Î¹ â†’ M} (h : âˆ‘ i, f i â€¢ x i = 0) : IsTrivialRelation f x :=
  iff_forall_isTrivialRelation.mp â€¹Flat R Mâ€º h
```

```suggestion
theorem exists_factorization_of_apply_eq_zero [Flat R M] {Î¹ : Type u} [Fintype Î¹]
    {f : Î¹ â†’â‚€ R} {x : (Î¹ â†’â‚€ R) â†’â‚—[R] M} (h : x f = 0) :
    âˆƒ (Îº : Type u) (_ : Fintype Îº) (a : (Î¹ â†’â‚€ R) â†’â‚—[R] (Îº â†’â‚€ R)) (y : (Îº â†’â‚€ R) â†’â‚—[R] M),
      x = y âˆ˜â‚— a âˆ§ a f = 0 := iff_forall_exists_factorization.mp â€¹Flat R Mâ€º h
```

```suggestion
theorem exists_factorization_of_apply_eq_zero_of_free [Flat R M] {N : Type u}
    [AddCommGroup N] [Module R N] [Free R N] [Finite R N] {f : N} {x : N â†’â‚—[R] M} (h : x f = 0) :
    âˆƒ (Îº : Type u) (_ : Fintype Îº) (a : N â†’â‚—[R] (Îº â†’â‚€ R)) (y : (Îº â†’â‚€ R) â†’â‚—[R] M),
      x = y âˆ˜â‚— a âˆ§ a f = 0 :=
  ((tfae_equational_criterion R M).out 0 5 rfl rfl).mp â€¹Flat R Mâ€º h
```
I don't really understand why the streamlined body only works when explicitly passing the two `rfl`s here.

```suggestion
  have (K' : Submodule R K) (hK' : K'.FG) : âˆƒ (Îº : Type u) (_ : Fintype Îº) (a : N â†’â‚—[R] (Îº â†’â‚€ R))
      (y : (Îº â†’â‚€ R) â†’â‚—[R] M), x = y âˆ˜â‚— a âˆ§ K' â‰¤ LinearMap.ker (a âˆ˜â‚— f) := by
    revert N
    apply Submodule.fg_induction (P := _) (N := K') (hN := hK')
```

```suggestion
    [Module R P] [FinitePresentation R P] (hâ‚ : P â†’â‚—[R] M) :
```

```suggestion
  obtain âŸ¨Îº, hÎº, a, y, hay, haâŸ© := exists_factorization_of_comp_eq_zero_of_free this
```
